meanings.definition: Comparative form of slab: having a flat, broad surface
meanings.sent1: The table was slabbier than the chair, with its wide top.
meanings.sent2: The sidewalk outside was slabbier than the one inside the building.
meanings.sent3: The slabbier pancake was so big, it covered the entire plate!
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed in the slabbier room, bouncing off the walls.
meanings.sent5: The slabbier stone in the pathway was perfect for sitting and resting.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of slab: lacking firmness or solidity
meanings.sent1: The slabbier dough was difficult to shape into cookies.
meanings.sent2: The slabbier ground made it hard to walk steadily.
meanings.sent3: The slabbier jelly wobbled on the plate, almost falling off.
meanings.sent4: His slabbier excuse for being late didn't convince anyone.
meanings.sent5: The slabbier ice cream melted quickly in the sun, dripping everywhere.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of slab: covered in slabs or pieces of material
meanings.sent1: The slabbier wall had layers of paint peeling off.
meanings.sent2: The slabbier roof was patched with different colored tiles.
meanings.sent3: The slabbier floor looked like a puzzle of mismatched tiles.
meanings.sent4: Her slabbier outfit was a mix of various patterns and textures.
meanings.sent5: The slabbier path in the garden was made of different types of stones.
